events.title: the 12th Street Riot begins in the early hours of the morning

movie.title: Detroit
movie.plot: A police raid in Detroit in 1967 results in one of the largest citizens' uprisings in the history of the United States.

events.title: Bobby Fischer receives a standing ovation for his opening against Boris Spassky in game 6

events.title: the "Gimli Glider" runs out of fuel mid-flight

movie.title: Falling from the Sky: Flight 174
movie.plot: True story of a brand-new Canadian airliner running out of fuel in-flight and forced to glide to the nearest airfield.

events.title: Tyke the elephant goes on a rampage

movie.title: Tyke Elephant Outlaw
movie.plot: This is the gripping and emotionally charged story of Tyke, a circus elephant that went on a rampage in Honolulu in 1994, killed her trainer in front of thousands of spectators and died in a hail of gunfire. Her break for freedom - filmed from start to tragic end - traumatised a city and ignited a global battle over the use of animals in the entertainment industry. Looking at what made Tyke snap, the film goes back to meet the people who knew her and were affected by her death - former trainers and handlers, circus industry insiders, witnesses to her rampage, and animal rights activists for whom Tyke became a global rallying cry. Like the classic animal rebellion film King Kong, Tyke is the central protagonist in a tragic but redemptive drama that combines trauma, outrage, insight and compassion. Ultimately, this moving documentary raises fundamental questions about our deep and mysterious connection to other species.
